definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
to lie down all over the place/exhausted and in disarray
Di Tang Quan - "Ground-Prone Fist"/"Ground Tumbling Boxing" - Martial Art
see 北京癱|北京瘫[Bei3 jing1 tan1]
(deprecatory) to lie motionless (asleep, drunk, lazing etc)
(Internet slang) to get unjustly ridiculed, attacked, implicated in sth etc while just being present/abbr. for 躺著也中槍|躺着也中枪[tang3 zhe5 ye3 zhong4 qiang1]
(lit.) to get shot even when lying down/(fig.) to get unjustly ridiculed, attacked, implicated in sth etc while just being present (Internet slang)/abbr. to 躺槍|躺枪[tang3 qiang1]
to win without needing to even lift a finger/victory presented on a platter

sentences.english: Shop windows were shattered. Cars were smashed.
sentences.chinese: 商店玻璃破碎，汽车被砸毁，大量伤者躺在街头。

sentences.english: It was in a corner that he lay, among weeds and nettles .
sentences.chinese: 它现在是躺在一个生满了荆棘和荒草的墙角边。

sentences.english: The lake lies low by the hill, a tearful entreaty of love at the foot of the inflexible.
sentences.chinese: 湖躺在山脚下，像在执拗者的跟前含泪恳求爱。
旁边躺著的就是你的爱人。

sentences.english: Lying in the emergency room looking pale.
sentences.chinese: 躺在急诊室的她脸色看起很苍白。

sentences.english: When the inebriated elk was freed, it lay for a while on the ground, seemingly unconscious.
sentences.chinese: 当“醉鬼”获救后，它在地上躺了一会，昏迷不醒。

sentences.english: On a bed of nails awake.
He wanted to see this grotesque sight, these dead bodies lying there.
sentences.chinese: 他想要看到这种怪诞的景像，这些尸体躺在那儿。

sentences.english: After dinner, woman cooed some suggestive little sighs and slipped invitingly into bed.
sentences.chinese: 晚饭后，女人含情脉脉，楚楚动人的躺到床上。

sentences.english: Summerville had no wish to join Mr. Marlowe on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 索姆威勒不希望和玛露先生一起躺在地板上。

sentences.english: He saw a tiger couching itself by the tree.
sentences.chinese: 他看见一只老虎躺在树旁。

sentences.english: He wasn't ill; he stayed in bed from laziness.
sentences.chinese: 他没病，躺在床上是因懒散之故。

sentences.english: Whoever you are, we too lie in drifts at your feet.
sentences.chinese: 无论你是谁，我们也在你脚边的漂流物中躺着。

sentences.english: Hundreds of deceased soldiers lay in a state of disarray.
sentences.chinese: 数百名死去的士兵横七竖八地躺在那里。

sentences.english: Paulus and Schmidt still lay in beds.
sentences.chinese: 保卢斯和施密特一直躺在床上。

sentences.english: Isn't that fun? I enjoy lying on the field at night and looking up at the starry sky.
sentences.chinese: 马可大哥喜欢夜晚时分躺在营地上，看著满天星斗。

definition: (lit.) to lie stiff like a corpse/(coll.) to sleep
to lie on one's stomach/to lean forward, resting one's upper body (on a desktop etc)/(Tw) percent
(deprecatory) to lie motionless (asleep, drunk, lazing etc)
